Web Application Privacy Protector

What is it?

The Web Application Privacy Protector (WAPP) is an add-on for Firefox that allows you to use online applications such as Google Docs or Zoho Writer while keeping the contents of your documents private from the application provider.

How does it work?

WAPP inserts itself between the field you are entering data into and the web application. When the web application tries to read data from the field, WAPP encrypts the field’s value on the fly before sending the result to the web application. When the web application tries to put data into the field, WAPP checks to see if the value is encrypted. If it is, WAPP will decrypt the value and insert that value into the field.
||
That’s it. It’s that simple.

Who made it?

WAPP was created by Gabriel Landau and Uma Chingude at the Johns Hopkins University Distributed Systems and Networks Laboratory.

How's it progressing?

Check out our Roadmap to see how we’re doing.

Where can I get it?

You can’t, yet. We’re working on packaging it into an XPI format, the standard Firefox extension format, so Firefox users can easily install and use it.
